member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.#ctor(Hamster.Database,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Constructor which creates a new Cursor

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.#ctor(Hamster.Database)
member.summary: Constructor which creates a new Cursor

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.#ctor(Hamster.Database,Hamster.Transaction)
member.summary: Constructor which creates a new Cursor in a Transaction

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.Create(Hamster.Database,Hamster.Transaction)
member.summary: Creates a new Cursor in a Transaction
member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_cursor_create function.
Creates a new Database Cursor. Cursors can be used to traverse the Database from start to end or vice versa. Cursors can also be used to insert, delete or search Database items.
A newly created Cursor does not point to any item in the Database.
The application should close all Database Cursors before closing the Database.

list.item: if the new structure could not be allocated

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.Clone
member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_cursor_clone function.
Clones an existing Cursor. The new Cursor will point to exactly the same item as the old Cursor. If the old Cursor did not point to any item, so will the new Cursor.
If the old Cursor is bound to a Transaction, then the new Cursor will also be bound to this Transaction.

list.item: if the new structure could not be allocated

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.Move(System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the Cursor to the direction specified in the flags
member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_cursor_move function.
Moves the Cursor. Use the flags to specify the direction. After the move, use Cursor.GetKey and Cursor.GetRecord to retrieve key and record of the item.
If the direction is not specified, the Cursor will not move.
member.param:
The direction for the move. If no direction is specified, the Cursor will remain on the current position. Possible flags are:
positions the Cursor to the first item in the Database
positions the Cursor to the last item in the Database
positions the Cursor to the next item in the Database; if the Cursor does not point to any item, the function behaves as if direction was .
positions the Cursor to the previous item in the Database; if the Cursor does not point to any item, the function behaves as if direction was .
skips duplicate keys of the current key. Not allowed in combination with .
only moves through duplicate keys of the current key. Not allowed in combination with .

list.item: if the Cursor points to the first (or last) item, and a move to the previous (or next) item was requested

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.MoveFirst
member.summary: Moves the Cursor to the first Database element

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.MoveLast
member.summary: Moves the Cursor to the last Database element

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.MoveNext
member.summary: Moves the Cursor to the next Database element

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.MoveNext(System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the Cursor to the next Database element

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.MovePrevious
member.summary: Moves the Cursor to the previous Database element

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.MovePrevious(System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the Cursor to the previous Database element

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.TryMove(System.Byte[]@,System.Byte[]@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Like , but returns false only if cursor points to the first (or last) item, and a move to the previous (or next) item was requested (i.e., when ham_cursor_move returns ).

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.GetKey
member.summary: Retrieves the Key of the current item
member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_cursor_move function.
Returns the key of the current Database item. Throws if the Cursor does not point to any item.
member.returns: The key of the current item

list.item: if the Cursor does not point to any item

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.GetRecord
member.summary: Retrieves the Record of the current item
member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_cursor_move function.
Returns the record of the current Database item. Throws if the Cursor does not point to any item.
member.returns: The record of the current item

list.item: if the Cursor does not point to any item

member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_cursor_overwrite function.
This function overwrites the record of the current item.

list.item: if the Cursor does not point to any item

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.Find(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Searches a key and points the Cursor to this key; returns the record of the key

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.Find(System.Byte[]@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches a key and points the Cursor to this key
member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_cursor_find function.
Searches for an item in the Database and points the Cursor to this item. If the item could not be found, the Cursor is not modified.
If the key has multiple duplicates, the Cursor is positioned on the first duplicate.

list.item: if the requested key was not found

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.TryFind(System.Byte[]@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches for a key and points the Cursor to this key
member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_cursor_find function.
Searches for an item in the Database and points the Cursor to this item. If the item could not be found, the Cursor is not modified and the return value is null.
If the key has multiple duplicates, the Cursor is positioned on the first duplicate.

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.TryFind(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches for a key and points the Cursor to this key
member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_cursor_find function.
Searches for an item in the Database and points the Cursor to this item. If the item could not be found, the Cursor is not modified and the return value is null.
If the key has multiple duplicates, the Cursor is positioned on the first duplicate.

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.TryFind(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Searches for a key and points the Cursor to this key
member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_cursor_find function.
Searches for an item in the Database and points the Cursor to this item. If the item could not be found, the Cursor is not modified and the return value is null.
If the key has multiple duplicates, the Cursor is positioned on the first duplicate.

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.Insert(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Inserts a Database item and points the Cursor to the new item
member.remarks: This is an overloaded function for Insert(key, record, 0).
member.param: The key of the new item
The record of the new item

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.Insert(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts a Database item and points the Cursor to the new item
member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_cursor_insert function.
This function inserts a key/record pair as a new Database item. If the key already exists in the Database, error is thrown.
If you wish to overwrite an existing entry specify the flag
If you wish to insert a duplicate key specify the flag . (Note that the Database has to be created with the flag in order to use duplicate keys.) By default, the duplicate key is inserted after all other duplicate keys (). This behaviour can be overwritten by specifying , or .
Specify the flag if you insert sequential data and the current key is higher than any other key in this Database. In this case hamsterdb will optimize the insert algorithm. hamsterdb will verify that this key is the highest; if not, it will perform a normal insert. This is the default for Record Number Databases.
Specify the flag if you insert sequential data and the current key is lower than any other key in this Database. In this case hamsterdb will optimize the insert algorithm. hamsterdb will verify that this key is the lowest; if not, it will perform a normal insert.
After inserting, the Cursor will point to the new item. If inserting the item failed, the Cursor is not modified.
member.param: The key of the new item
The record of the new item

Optional flags for this operation, combined with bitwise OR. Possible flags are:
If the key already exists, the record is overwritten. Otherwise, the key is inserted.
If the key already exists, a duplicate key is inserted. The key is inserted after the already existing duplicates. Same as .
If the key already exists, a duplicate key is inserted before the duplicate pointed to by this Cursor.
If the key already exists, a duplicate key is inserted after the duplicate pointed to by this Cursor.
If the key already exists, a duplicate key is inserted as the first duplicate of the current key.
If the key already exists, a duplicate key is inserted as the last duplicate of the current key.

list.item: if the flags HamConst.HAM_DUPLICATE AND HamConst.HAM_OVERWRITE were specified, or if HamConst.HAM_DUPLICATE was specified but the Database was not created with HamConst.HAM_ENABLE_DUPLICATE_KEYS
if you tried to insert a key in a read-only Database
if key size is different than than the key size parameter specified for Database.Create.

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.Erase
member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_cursor_erase function.
Erases a key from the Database. If the erase was successfull, the Cursor is invalidated, and does no longer point to any item. In case of an error, the Cursor is not modified.
If the Database was opened with the flag , this function erases only the duplicate item to which the Cursor refers.

list.item: if the Cursor does not point to any item
if you tried to erase a key from a read-only Database

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.GetDuplicateCount
member.summary: Returns the number of duplicate keys
member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_cursor_get_duplicate_count function.
Returns the number of duplicate keys of the item to which the Cursor currently refers.
Returns 1 if the key has no duplicates.
member.returns: The number of duplicate keys of the current item

list.item: if the Cursor does not point to any item

member.name: M:Hamster.Cursor.Close
member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_cursor_close function.
Closes this Cursor and frees allocated memory. All Cursors should be closed before closing the Database.

member.name: T:Hamster.Parameter
member.summary: An extended Parameter, used i.e. in Database.Open, Database.Create

member.name: T:Hamster.Version
member.summary: Structure for the hamsterdb Version Information

member.name: T:Hamster.CompareFunc
member.remarks:
This delegate compares two keys - the "left-hand side" (lhs) and the "right-hand side" (rhs).
Also see .
member.returns: -1 if the first key (lhs) is smaller, +1 if the first key is larger, 0 if both keys are equal

member.name: T:Hamster.ErrorHandler
member.remarks: This delegate method is called whenever a message is emitted.
member.param: The debug level (0 = Debug, 1 = Normal, 3 = Fatal)

member.name: M:Hamster.Database.SetErrorHandler(Hamster.ErrorHandler)
member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_set_error_handler function.
This handler will receive all debug messages that are emitted by hamsterdb. You can install the default handler by setting eh to null.
member.param: The delegate which is called whenever an error message is emitted; set to null to set the default error handler

member.name: M:Hamster.Database.SetCompareFunc(Hamster.CompareFunc)
member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_db_set_compare_func function.
The delegate compares two index keys. It returns -1 if the first key is smaller, +1 if the second key is smaller or 0 if both keys are equal.
If is null, hamsterdb will use the default compare function (which is based on memcmp(3)).

member.name: M:Hamster.Database.GetLastError
member.remarks: This method wraps the native ham_db_get_error function.
member.returns: The error code of the last operation

member.name: M:Hamster.Database.Find(Hamster.Transaction,System.Byte[]@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches an item in the Database, returns the record
member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_db_find function.
This function searches the Database for a key. If the key is found, the method will return the record of this item.
Database.Find can not search for duplicate keys. If the key has multiple duplicates, only the first duplicate is returned.

list.item: if the item was not found

member.name: M:Hamster.Database.Insert(Hamster.Transaction,System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_db_insert function.
This function inserts a key/record pair as a new Database item.
If the key already exists in the Database, error code is thrown.
If you wish to overwrite an existing entry specify the flag
If you wish to insert a duplicate key specify the flag . (Note that the Database has to be created with the flag in order to use duplicate keys.) The duplicate key is inserted after all other duplicate keys (see ).
member.param: The key of the new item
The record of the new item

Optional flags for this operation. Possible flags are:
If the key already exists, the record is overwritten. Otherwise, the key is inserted.
If the key already exists, a duplicate key is inserted. The key is inserted before the already existing duplicates.

list.item: if the flags HamConst.HAM_DUPLICATE AND HamConst.HAM_OVERWRITE were specified, or if HamConst.HAM_DUPLICATE was specified but the Database was not created with HamConst.HAM_ENABLE_DUPLICATE_KEYS
if you tried to insert a key in a read-only Database
if key size is different than than the key size parameter specified for Database.Create.

member.summary: Inserts a Database Item into a Record Number Database

member.name: M:Hamster.Database.Erase(Hamster.Transaction,System.Byte[])
member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_db_erase function.
This function erases a Database item. If the item with the specified key does not exist in the Database, error code is thrown.
Note that this method can not erase a single duplicate key. If the key has multiple duplicates, all duplicates of this key will be erased. Use to erase a specific duplicate key.
member.param: The key of the item to delete

list.item: if the key was not found
if you tried to insert a key in a read-only Database

member.name: M:Hamster.Environment.Create(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,Hamster.Parameter[])
member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_env_create function.
A Database Environment is a collection of Databases, which are all stored in one physical file (or in-memory). Per default, up to 16 Databases can be stored in one file ( on how to store even more Databases).
Each Database is identified by a positive 16bit value (except 0 and values at or above 0xf000). Databases in an Environment can be created with or opened with .
member.param: The file name of the Environment file. If the file already exists, it is overwritten. Can be null if you create an In-Memory Environment.

Optional flags for this operation, combined with bitwise OR. Possible flags are:
Immediately write modified pages to the disk. This slows down all Database operations, but may save the Database integrity in case of a system crash.
Creates an In-Memory Environment. No file will be created, and the Databases are lost after the Environment is closed. The parameter can be null. Do NOT use in combination with a cache size other than 0.
Do not use memory mapped files for I/O. By default, hamsterdb checks if it can use mmap, since mmap is faster than read/write. For performance reasons, this flag should not be used.
Enables logging/recovery for this Database. Not allowed in combination with , and .
Enables Transactions for this Database. This flag implies .
File access rights for the new file. This is the mode parameter for creat(2). Ignored on Microsoft Windows.

An array of structures. The following parameters are available:
The size of the Database cache, in bytes. The default size is defined in src/config.h as HAM_DEFAULT_CACHESIZE - usually 2 MB.
The size of a file page, in bytes. It is recommended not to change the default size. The default size depends on hardware and operating system. Page sizes must be 1024 or a multiple of 2048.
The number of maximum Databases in this Environment; default: 16.

list.item: if an invalid combination of flags was specified
if the value for HAM_PARAM_MAX_DATABASES is too high (either decrease it or increase the page size)
if the file could not be opened or reading/writing failed
if memory could not be allocated
if the page size is not a multiple of 1024
if the key size is too large (at least 4 keys must fit in a page)
if another process has locked the file

member.name: M:Hamster.Environment.Open(System.String)
member.remarks: This is an overloaded function for Open(fileName, 0, null).

member.name: M:Hamster.Environment.Open(System.String,System.Int32)
member.remarks: This is an overloaded function for Open(fileName, flags, null).

member.name: M:Hamster.Environment.Open(System.String,System.Int32,Hamster.Parameter[])
member.remarks: This method wraps the native ham_env_open function.
member.param: The file name of the Environment file.

Optional flags for this operation, combined with bitwise OR. Possible flags are:
Opens the file for reading only. Operations which need write access (i.e. Database.Insert) will return .
Immediately write modified pages to the disk. This slows down all Database operations, but may save the Database integrity in case of a system crash.
Do not use memory mapped files for I/O. By default, hamsterdb checks if it can use mmap, since mmap is faster than read/write. For performance reasons, this flag should not be used.
Enables logging/recovery for this Database. Will return , if the Database is in an inconsistent state. Not allowed in combination with , and .
Automatically recover the Database, if necessary. This flag imples .
Enables Transactions for this Database. This flag implies .

An array of structures. The following parameters are available:
The size of the Database cache, in bytes. The default size is defined in src/config.h as HAM_DEFAULT_CACHESIZE - usually 2 MB.

list.item: if an invalid combination of flags was specified
if the file does not exist
if the file could not be opened or reading/writing failed
if the Database version is not compatible with the library version
if memory could not be allocated
if another process has locked the file

member.name: M:Hamster.Environment.CreateDatabase(System.Int16)
member.summary: Creates a new Database in this Environment
member.remarks: This is an overloaded function for CreateDatabase(name, 0, null).

member.summary: Creates a new Database in this Environment
member.remarks: This is an overloaded function for CreateDatabase(name, flags, null).

member.name: M:Hamster.Environment.CreateDatabase(System.Int16,System.Int32,Hamster.Parameter[])
member.summary: Creates a new Database in this Environment
member.remarks: This method wraps the native ham_env_create_db function.
member.param: The name of the Database. If a Database with this name already exists, is thrown. Database names from 0xf000 to 0xffff and 0 are reserved.

Optional flags for creating the Database, combined with bitwise OR. Possible values are:
Creates an "auto-increment" Database. Keys in Record Number Databases are automatically assigned an incrementing 64bit value.

An array of structures. The following parameters are available:
The size of the keys in the B+Tree index. The default size is 21 bytes.

list.item: if an invalid combination of flags was specified
if a Database with this name already exists in this Environment
if memory could not be allocated
if the key size is too large (at least 4 keys must fit in a page)
if the maximum number of Databases per Environment was already created

member.param: The name of the Database. If a Database with this name does not exist, the function will throw .

Optional flags for this operation, combined with bitwise OR. Possible flags are:
Opens the database for reading.
An array of structures. The following parameters are available:

list.item: if an invalid combination of flags was specified
if a Database with this name does not exist
if this Database was already opened
if memory could not be allocated
if another process has locked the file

member.param: The old name of the Database. If a Database with this name does not exist, the function will throw .
The new name of the Database. If a Database with this name already exists, the function will throw .

member.name: M:Hamster.Environment.Flush
member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_env_flush function.
This function flushes the Database cache and writes the whole file to disk.
Since In-Memory Environments do not have a file on disk, the function will have no effect and will return successfully.

member.name: M:Hamster.Environment.GetDatabaseNames
member.summary: Returns the names of all Databases in this Environment
member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_env_get_database_names function.
This function returns the names of all Databases and the number of Databases in an Environment.
member.returns: An Array with all Database names

member.name: M:Hamster.Environment.Begin(System.Int32)
member.remarks: This method wraps the native ham_txn_begin function.

member.name: M:Hamster.Environment.Close
member.remarks: This method wraps the native ham_env_close function.

member.name: M:Hamster.Transaction.Commit
member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_txn_commit function.
Note that the function will fail with HAM_CURSOR_STILL_OPEN if a Cursor was attached to this Transaction, and the Cursor was not closed.

member.name: M:Hamster.Transaction.Abort
member.summary: Aborts the Transaction if it has not already been committed or aborted.
member.remarks:
This method wraps the native ham_txn_abort function.
Note that the function will fail with HAM_CURSOR_STILL_OPEN if a Cursor was attached to this Transaction, and the Cursor was not closed.

member.name: M:Hamster.Transaction.Dispose
member.summary: Aborts the Transaction if it has not already been committed or aborted.
